shared.model

Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • shared.model.Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    The bank class keeps track of all transactions relating to the cards, the players, and results of the robber.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Bank()
      Constructs a new Bank object and initializes the decks of cards
      Bank(int wheat, int brick, int wood, int sheep, int ore, int soldiers, int monopoly, int yearOfPlenty, int roadBuilder, int monument)
      Constructs a new Bank object and initializes the decks of cards.
      Intended for initialization from the server Model

      • canDoBuyDevelopmentCard

        public boolean canDoBuyDevelopmentCard(ResourceCard sheep,
                              ResourceCard wheat,
                              ResourceCard ore)
        Whenever somebody is taking development cards from the bank, this method is called. This method makes the necessary adjustment to the deck, which cards are still in it, and how many total are left.
        Parameters:
        int - take is a number of the development cards a player is taking
        Player - player is the player purchasing the cards

      • playerTurnInResources

        public void playerTurnInResources(ResourceCard[] resources)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method supposedly can be an independent turnIn function that supports the turn in whether it is from having more than 7 cards on a 7 roll, or a trade with the bank. It only cares that the resources are valid resources. the trade function should have already assured that they are the same type. Is this correct?
        Parameters:
        resources -
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
